ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Eustachian Tube Dysfunction / Middle Ear Effusion
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports fullness and congestion coinciding with allergies; tympanometry shows negative pressure and hypocompliance; air-bone gap present in the right ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Noise-Induced Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of racing car noise exposure; audiogram shows a 4000 Hz notch in the left ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Presbycusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Underlying bilateral high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss consistent with age (68 years).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear Pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss warrants investigation to rule out retrocochlear etiology.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition scores.
To evaluate middle ear status given the report of fullness and congestion.
To assess the acoustic reflex arc and aid in differentiating conductive vs. sensorineural vs. retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The right ear demonstrates a slight to mild mixed hearing loss sloping to severe sensorineural loss, with a conductive component indicated by an air-bone gap, excessive negative middle ear pressure, and hypocompliance. The left ear shows normal hearing sloping to a mild sensorineural notch at 4000 Hz. Acoustic reflexes are absent in the right ear (consistent with conductive pathology) and present in the left ear.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight to mild mixed loss (250-2000 Hz) sloping to severe SNHL (3000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Normal (250-3000 Hz) sloping to mild SNHL notch at 4000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: Right 32 dB, Left 8 dB. WRS: Right 86% (slight difficulty), Left 96% (normal).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right: Excessive negative pressure (-150 daPa) and hypocompliance (0.1 mL). Left: Normal (-30 daPa, 0.7 mL).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral/contralateral: Absent. Left ipsilateral: Present 500-2000 Hz, absent 4000 Hz. Left contralateral: Absent.

proposed_items: Prescription of allergy medication to address Eustachian tube dysfunction
Referral for ABR to rule out retrocochlear pathology after conductive component clears
counseling_actions: Explain the mixed nature of the hearing loss in the right ear
Discuss the relationship between seasonal allergies, Eustachian tube dysfunction, and ear fullness
Review the impact of noise exposure and the noise notch observed in the left ear
Recommend hearing protection to prevent further damage

escalation.rationale_short: For management of allergy-related Eustachian tube dysfunction and evaluation of asymmetric hearing loss.

follow_up_plan.timeline: After resolution of the conductive component
follow_up_plan.objective: Conduct ABR testing to rule out retrocochlear pathology.
